column4: i installed module-assistant and tried it for nvidia but nvidia-kernel-source build fails
i think something is missing from my system
does ubuntu version refer to year.month?
yes
yes
at least I think so.. why not check the ubuntu site.. all this info is there

run this in a terminal, "tail -f /var/log/syslog".. disconnect the drive, reconnect it... wait a couple of seconds.. pastebin whatever showed up in the terminal window (ctrl+c to close that command when you're done)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/110420/
it doesn't stop
could be a usb power overload
sorry.. I've been preparing to go out.. don't have time to help you.. but ask the channel again.. I'm sure someone has some idea
you mean rename? try "mv"
can you give me an example using mv
mv awesomefile.txt awesomefile.data will change the name from awesomefile.txt to awesomefile.data ... it will still be the same text file though
i tried batch converting and it gave me file finemane.ext is not a directory
I never said you could use that straight away on several files at once
what are you trying to do?
batch convert some files with ext1 to ext2
my example was only for one file
how about using wildcards mv *.ext1 *.ext2
I don't think it's that easy.. have you searched in synaptic for "rename files" ? I think there are a couple of utilities
did it,  using this command:   for f in *ext1 ; do mv $f `basename $f ext1`ext2; done
but still kind of elegant =) I would probably have made it uglier =)
